article_text:
TOKYO—The Bank of Japan’s recent move to pump up the economy is supposed to encourage more lending by commercial banks. But it could actually hurt banks by reducing long-term interest rates and limiting profit margins on bread-and-butter domestic lending, analysts say.

“I don’t see any positives for banks from this BOJ easing,” said Shinichi Tamura, an analyst with Barclays in Tokyo. He said the central bank would have trouble...

twitter.title: BOJ ‘Bazooka’ Could Squeeze Bank Profits
